title: How the UK economy – and you – must change to reach net zero carbon emissions
text:
Picture the scene. You are driving home in your zippy electric car and need to recharge the batteries.

Two lamp posts on your street have chargers unobtrusively installed, making this vehicle the perfect purchase. No trips to the petrol station, no car tax, no eco-guilt.

Unfortunately the parking spaces are taken by petrol cars.

So you head a few streets over to the nearest rapid charging station.

Luckily it has an unoccupied reserved parking space. You plug in, pay up and can at last put your feet up for the evening – after walking home through the autumn rain. And you have to move the car later once it has charged up.

This does not sound fun, but you may have little choice about it in future...
